language.name: Spanish
language.notes: Starter deck focused on intentions, polite requests, and cafe dialogs.

patterns.label: Quiero + infinitivo
patterns.description: Expressing desires or plans using 'quiero' followed by an infinitive verb.

examples.sentence: Quiero aprender español todos los días.
examples.translation: I want to learn Spanish every day.
examples.explanation: Highlight routine intention with time expression.

examples.sentence: Quiero viajar a México el próximo verano.
examples.translation: I want to travel to Mexico next summer.

patterns.label: Me gustaría + infinitivo
patterns.description: Softening requests or wishes with the conditional 'gustaría'.

examples.sentence: Me gustaría probar un postre típico.
examples.translation: I would like to try a traditional dessert.
examples.explanation: Shows polite tone for ordering food.

errorTypes.name: Gender agreement
errorTypes.description: Make sure adjectives match the noun gender.

examples.explanation: 'Casa' is feminine, so the article must be 'la'.

errorTypes.name: Verb form after 'quiero'
errorTypes.description: Use infinitive verbs when expressing desires.

feedbackModes.label: Explain in English
feedbackModes.description: Use simple English explanations for every fix.

feedbackModes.label: Spanish + English
feedbackModes.description: Short Spanish note followed by English clarification.

scenarios.title: Café order
scenarios.goal: Order a drink and small snack politely.

turns.speaker: barista
turns.translation: Good morning! What would you like to drink today?
turns.feedback: Notice inverted question marks and familiar 'te'.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.prompt: Respond using 'Me gustaría...' and include a pastry if possible.

turns.speaker: barista
turns.text: Perfecto. ¿Algo más para acompañar tu bebida?
turns.translation: Perfect. Anything else to go with your drink?

tips: Reuse vocabulary from Pattern Learning for consistency.
Keep sentences short for easier model feedback.
